must_have: Energy sector knowledge (PV, storage, power control, energy management)

candidate_intelligence_dossiers.name: Arkadiusz Tyran

validation_status.justification: Strong embedded C/C++ background with 10+ years IoT experience at reputable companies. Currently works at needCode (Software Application Engineer for Qorvo). Deep expertise in BLE, Zigbee, Matter, FreeRTOS, Linux platforms. No direct energy/Modbus but strongest transferable embedded/IoT skills. Located in Kraków area (AGH alumnus).

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Highly experienced embedded systems engineer (10+ years) specializing in IoT and Smart Home technologies. Currently works at needCode, a leading Kraków-based IoT development company (9+ years operating, 25+ senior developers, certified Qorvo partner). Master's degree in Electronics from AGH. Career progression: Silvair (2013-2018, BLE Mesh pioneer) → InPost (2018-2022, parcel machine firmware) → Qorvo/needCode (2022-present, IoT microcontrollers). Participated in BLE Mesh standardization and was part of the first BLE Mesh certification team. Company (needCode) specializes in UWB, BLE, Zigbee, Matter—exactly the wireless protocols relevant to modern IoT/energy gateways.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Professional, experienced in startup/scaleup environments (Silvair, needCode). Used to working with international clients (needCode serves US, EU markets). Kraków-based, which is perfect for hybrid work model. AGH network provides strong local tech community connections. Company culture suggests collaborative, hands-on engineering approach.

technical_hard_skills: C/C++ embedded systems (bare-metal, FreeRTOS, Zephyr) - 10+ years verified
Linux platform development (Smart Home Gateway: BLE, Zigbee, OpenThread integration)
Wireless protocols: BLE, BLE Mesh (standardization participation), Zigbee, Matter, RF4CE, UWB
IoT microcontrollers: Qorvo chips, nRF52, ESP32
Python (automated testing, Behave, scripting)
Angular/TypeScript (front-end, UX/UI)
Hardware: PCB soldering, measurements, hardware R&D
Network communication: REST APIs, TCP/IP, client-server architectures
Git, CI/CD, automated testing frameworks
SDK development and maintenance (Qorvo SDKs for Remote Controls, Smart Home Gateways)
soft_skills_culture: Fluent English, multinational environment (needCode clients in 7+ countries)
Collaborative team player (needCode emphasizes team collaboration)
National Electronics Olympiad finalist (2012) - demonstrates deep technical passion
AGH alumnus - strong local Kraków tech network

online_presence.company: needCode - ISO 9001/27001 certified, Qorvo certified partner, 40+ completed projects
online_presence.company_focus: UWB, BLE, Zigbee, Matter, embedded software, IoT strategic roadmap
online_presence.github_public: Not found in public searches (likely private repositories for commercial work)
online_presence.professional_reputation: Works at well-regarded Kraków IoT company with strong industry partnerships

gap_analysis: No direct energy sector, OZE, PV, or storage experience - NEEDS DOMAIN TRAINING
No explicit Modbus TCP/RTU protocol experience - TRAINABLE (similar to other industrial protocols he's worked with)
No documented POSIX/pthread experience (likely implicit in Linux Gateway work) - NEEDS VERIFICATION IN INTERVIEW
No explicit GCC/GDB usage stated (embedded work implies this) - VERIFY IN INTERVIEW
Currently employed at Qorvo/needCode (since Aug 2022) - NOTICE PERIOD UNKNOWN
Salary expectations likely 20,000-31,000 PLN range given seniority and current role
Age ~32-33 (graduated 2012-2016 AGH)
interview_strategy: TECHNICAL DEPTH: Walk me through your Smart Home Gateway Linux platform project. How did you handle concurrent BLE/Zigbee/OpenThread communication? What threading model did you use?
PROTOCOL LEARNING: You have deep BLE Mesh experience. How would you approach learning Modbus TCP/RTU? What are the key differences between Modbus and protocols you've worked with?
DEBUGGING: Describe your most challenging firmware debugging scenario at Qorvo or InPost. What tools did you use (GDB, oscilloscope, logic analyzer)?
SYSTEMS ARCHITECTURE: How would you design a Linux-based gateway for an energy management system that needs to poll 20+ Modbus devices (inverters, batteries, meters) with different response times?
HARDWARE INTEGRATION: Your CV mentions PCB soldering and hardware R&D. Describe a project where you had to debug hardware-software integration issues.
CAREER LOGISTICS: What is your notice period at needCode? What attracts you to energy sector work? What are your salary expectations?
DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE: What do you know about photovoltaic systems, battery storage, or energy management? Are you willing to learn this domain?

additional_info.avail_from: Unknown - currently employed (likely 1-3 month notice period)
additional_info.company_verification: needCode is real, reputable Kraków IoT company (founded 2015, 10-49 employees, ISO certified, Qorvo partner)

recruiter_notes.red_flags: None identified. Solid career progression, stable employment, real company.
recruiter_notes.green_flags: LOCAL TO KRAKÓW, 10+ years experience, works at reputable IoT company, AGH degree, perfect IoT/embedded background for energy gateway work
recruiter_notes.competitive_intel: Currently at stable, interesting job (IoT for Qorvo). Will need compelling offer: challenging energy domain + competitive salary + growth opportunity. May have other offers.
recruiter_notes.urgency: HIGH PRIORITY CANDIDATE - Schedule interview ASAP before competitors approach him

validation_status.justification: Very junior profile (23 years old, 6 months total experience). Currently 3rd year student at WSZ Kraków. Limited C/C++ exposure from 3-month internship. No embedded, Linux system programming, POSIX, multithreading, or energy sector experience. Not ready for mid-level position, but could be considered for junior/intern role with heavy mentorship.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Young developer (DOB: 21.06.2001, 23 years old) in early career stage. Currently studying Computer Science at WSZ Kraków (Wyższa Szkoła Zarządzania i Bankowości - private business/management school, not technical polytechnic). Limited commercial experience: 3-month C++ internship at Instytut Fotonowy (optical equipment manufacturer for research labs) doing bug fixes and refactoring, followed by 3-month network support role at Kb-System (Sep-Nov 2025) helping with basic network issues. Electrical vocational background (low-voltage electrician from TZGK Grodno, Belarus) could be asset for understanding hardware, but no evidence of practical application. Multilingual (Russian native, Polish/English intermediate) due to Belarusian origin.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Eager to learn, multilingual, seems motivated. However, very junior with limited depth. Would need extensive mentorship and structured onboarding. May be better suited for internship program than immediate contributor role. Currently studying, so availability/commitment may be limited.

candidate_intelligence_dossiers.name: Fryderyk Musiał

validation_status.justification: Strong academic/research background (Master's UVSQ Paris-Saclay, HPC R&D at Li-PaRAD laboratory). Deep C/C++ and low-level optimization expertise (assembly x86/ARM, OpenMPI, OpenMP). However, NO commercial embedded systems experience, NO energy sector knowledge, NO Modbus/industrial protocols. HPC research focus is different paradigm from real-time embedded systems. Would need significant domain retraining despite strong fundamentals.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Highly educated multilingual computer engineer (French as second native language, fluent English TOEIC 990/990, German B1, Polish, Russian basic). Master's degree from UVSQ Paris-Saclay in Informatics (Calcul Haute Performance et Simulation - High Performance Computing and Simulation program, one of Europe's top HPC programs). Most recent work: HPC R&D engineer at Li-PaRAD laboratory (Mar-Nov 2025) working on European Processor Initiative (collaboration with SiPearl, Barcelona Supercomputing Center, RWTH Aachen) focusing on performance analysis of parallel C/C++ codes and x86/ARM assembly optimization. Prior to that: SAP consulting (May-Aug 2024, ABAP/SAPUI5) - not relevant. Strong analytical, academic rigor, documentation skills. Hobbies include motorsport, Arduino DIY projects, retro tech - suggests hands-on maker mindset despite academic focus. Currently in Kraków (likely returned after French contract ended).
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Academic rigor and meticulous attention to detail. Used to research environments with heavy documentation and reporting. May struggle with fast-paced startup environments or rapid prototyping without specifications. Multilingual and internationally experienced. Arduino hobby suggests interest in embedded/hardware, but no commercial embedded experience. Good for technically deep, performance-critical projects where optimization matters.

technical_hard_skills: C/C++ (HPC kernels, performance optimization, code profiling)
Assembly language (x86, ARM) - low-level performance analysis and optimization
Parallel programming: OpenMPI, OpenMP (HPC paradigm, NOT pthread/embedded RTOS)
Linux (Arch, Gentoo, Debian, Ubuntu) - advanced user/administrator, NOT embedded Linux
Python (scripting, automation, data visualization, matplotlib/Excel)
Bash shell scripting (automated testing, CI pipelines)
Git (GitHub, GitLab), CMake/Make
Performance profiling and optimization (HPC context)
Network administration basics: DHCP, DNS, Docker, REST/SOAP APIs
SAP technologies: ABAP, SAPUI5, JavaScript, OData (consulting work, not relevant)
Academic projects: Autonomous vehicle (C++, OpenCV, ROS), Arduino (hobby DIY)
soft_skills_culture: Multilingual: French (native-level), English (fluent, TOEIC 990/990 - perfect score), Polish (fluent), German (B1), Russian (basic)
International research experience (France, European Processor Initiative)
Academic research collaboration (Intel, CEA, GENCI, multiple European HPC centers)
Hobbyist maker: motorsport, Arduino projects, retro tech

online_presence.github_public: Not found under fredmsl256 or variants (likely private or minimal public presence)

education_verification.UVSQ Paris-Saclay: Real, top-tier French university (part of Université Paris-Saclay, ranked #1 French university in HPC/Computer Engineering)
education_verification.Li-PaRAD: Real laboratory at UVSQ (Laboratoire d'Informatique Parallélisme Réseaux Algorithmes Distribués)
education_verification.European Processor Initiative: Real EU-funded project (EPI) for European HPC processor development
education_verification.Master CHPS: Master Calcul Haute Performance et Simulation - prestigious HPC program

online_presence.professional_reputation: Strong academic credentials, participation in high-level EU research projects

gap_analysis: CRITICAL: NO commercial embedded systems or real-time programming experience
NO energy sector, OZE, PV, or storage experience - NEEDS FULL DOMAIN TRAINING
NO Modbus TCP/RTU or industrial protocol experience - NEEDS TRAINING
NO hardware integration (inverters, batteries, meters) experience
NO POSIX/pthread documented (HPC uses OpenMPI/OpenMP, DIFFERENT PARADIGM from embedded)
NO commercial Linux application development (sockets, TCP/IP at embedded system level)
Recent work is HPC research (Mar-Nov 2025) and SAP consulting - NEITHER DIRECTLY RELEVANT
May need significant adaptation from batch/HPC mindset to real-time/embedded mindset
Arduino hobby projects are not commercial-grade embedded work
Age ~27-28 (graduated Master's 2025, likely 5-year program started ~2020)
interview_strategy: HPC TO EMBEDDED TRANSFER: Your HPC work involved OpenMPI/OpenMP. How is this different from POSIX threads? How would you approach a real-time embedded system with hard timing constraints?
LOW-LEVEL SKILLS: You have strong assembly optimization skills. Walk me through how you would debug a race condition or deadlock in a multithreaded application.
SYSTEMS THINKING: Describe your autonomous vehicle project (C++, OpenCV, ROS). What were the real-time constraints? How did you handle sensor data processing and concurrent control loops?
PROTOCOL LEARNING: How would you approach learning Modbus protocol and integrating it with embedded Linux devices? What resources would you use?
CAREER TRANSITION: Why are you interested in moving from HPC research to commercial embedded/energy systems? What attracts you to this role?
PRACTICAL SKILLS: Your Arduino hobby suggests hands-on interest. Can you describe an Arduino project you built? What did you learn about embedded constraints?
AVAILABILITY & LOGISTICS: What is your current status? Are you available immediately? What are your salary expectations? Preferred work mode (remote/hybrid/on-site)?

additional_info.avail_from: Likely immediately available (HPC contract ended Nov 2025)
additional_info.expected_net: Likely 15,000-25,000 PLN range (research background, international experience, but no commercial embedded)
additional_info.exp_similar: No (no direct energy sector or commercial embedded experience)
additional_info.education_level: Master's degree (UVSQ Paris-Saclay, top-tier French university)

recruiter_notes.red_flags: NO commercial embedded experience (core requirement), HPC research mindset may not transfer well to real-time embedded, would need 3-6 months retraining, Arduino hobby ≠ commercial embedded work
recruiter_notes.green_flags: Exceptional low-level C/C++/assembly skills, perfect English + multilingual, top-tier education, meticulous/analytical, local to Kraków, available immediately, autonomous vehicle project shows some embedded exposure
recruiter_notes.recommendation: MEDIUM-RISK HIRE. Strong fundamentals but wrong domain. Consider if: (1) willing to invest 3-6 months training in embedded/energy domain, (2) have senior mentor available, (3) prioritize code quality and optimization over immediate productivity. His HPC optimization skills could be valuable for performance-critical EMS algorithms once domain knowledge is acquired.
recruiter_notes.interview_approach: Focus on transferable skills (low-level debugging, performance optimization, systems thinking) and assess learning agility. Be transparent about domain gap and training expectations.

Academic institutions (AGH, UVSQ Paris-Saclay, WSZ Kraków)
Research projects (European Processor Initiative, Li-PaRAD publications)
